<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENVIRONMENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/18/iea-sets-400-step-plan-reach-2050-climate-goals?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
How to Become the Net-Zero Hero
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/18/iea-sets-400-step-plan-reach-2050-climate-goals" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="An illustration of a generic-looking brick factory; trees are growing out of the top of its three smokestacks" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zODU4L3N1c3RhaW5hYmlsaXR5LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In a halftime speech for the ages, the International Energy Agency <a href="https://www.axios.com/iea-analysis-charts-narrow-pathway-to-paris-climate-goal-a337723f-cc56-4186-937c-963be7791c26.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">released</a> a major report yesterday urging countries to go out there and score their 2050 climate goals. The path is "narrow and extremely challenging" but can be done...if they start now. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What are those goals? </strong>To prevent the worst effects of climate change, the 2015 Paris Agreement set a 2050 deadline to reach net-zero emissions and cap the rise in global temperatures above preindustrial levels at 1.5°C. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So the IEA went full Leslie Knope and <a href="https://www.npr.org/2021/05/18/997834721/no-new-oil-and-coal-projects-now-to-be-carbon-neutral-by-2050-report-says?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">released</a> 400+ milestones for governments, including...</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Blocking new investments in oil and gas fields starting next year</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Ending the sale of internal combustion engine-powered cars by 2035</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Quadrupling the amount of new solar and wind capacity that is added annually by 2040</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The messenger matters.</strong> The IEA was set up in the 1970s to help keep oil supplies stable and affordable. It's expanded that focus to other energy sources and global policy, but has always been seen as cozy with the fossil fuel industry.  </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">So what changed?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Short answer: The status quo isn't cutting it. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">While more countries have made net-zero pledges, emissions are still rising. And, based on existing national targets, the IEA estimates that by 2050 there will still be 22 billion tons of CO2 emissions.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In the US, 59% of electricity was generated using natural gas or coal last year, according to the US Energy Information Administration.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The gameplan</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Some countries have taken big steps—Denmark pledged an end to new fossil fuel exploration, the UK is phasing out new sales of gas-powered vehicles. But it's not enough, the IEA said. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The agency says humans have the technology to make most of the CO2 cuts needed by 2030, but some of the technologies needed after that are still in R&D. Therefore, the report's authors called for more innovation in technologies including hydrogen production, battery tech, and carbon capture, and more investment to decarbonize industries including aviation, transportation, and construction. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>governments have six months to simmer on these recs before the UN Climate Change Conference in Glasgow, Scotland, this November.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
STOCKS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/18/teens-can-now-trade-stocks-fidelity?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Teens Entering the Stock Market Like
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>

<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/18/teens-can-now-trade-stocks-fidelity" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Lizzie McGuire" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=447 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/E1xgKbLawJOYo/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Lizzie McGuire" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/E1xgKbLawJOYo/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Sheeeeeeesh Gen Z readers (did we use that right?), because Fidelity <a href="https://apnews.com/article/business-369bf5f29e39ee441829c1de4cfeedd1?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">just launched</a> trading accounts for 13–17-year-olds. That means teens can open an account to make deposits, use a debit card, or trade stocks, mutual funds, and most ETFs. To sign up, they just need a parent with a Fidelity account, who will be able to keep tabs on their kids' transactions but—unlike other products on the market today—can't block them.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If it feels like your investing friends <a href="https://www.reuters.com/world/us/fidelity-launches-brokerage-account-aimed-13-17-year-olds-2021-05-18/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">keep getting younger</a>, they are: Investors opened 4.1 million new brokerage accounts on Fidelity last quarter, and 1.6 million were run by people 35 and younger, a 223% annual increase.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>With young traders entering the market in droves during the pandemic, Fidelity wants to become middle- and high schoolers' first and only active investing option.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>when teens with Fidelity Youth Accounts turn 18, their account switches into Fidelity's standard brokerage offering for grown-ups. So this banking product's not just Gen Z's first Finance 101 class, but a longer-term customer acquisition strategy.</p>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/18/google-announces-slate-new-features?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Oodles of Google
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Google announced a grab bag of new products and features at its <a href="https://www.axios.com/google-announcements-io-2021-6bc5c914-39c5-4b1d-8919-a2db1c85c153.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">I/O developer conference</a> yesterday, several of which would make Squidward curl into a ball and whimper "future." </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">On Google Search, you'll be able to...</strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Search skin, hair, and nail issues by </span><span><a href="https://www.fastcompany.com/90637506/google-ai-dermatologist?partner=feedburner&utm_source=feedly&utm_medium=webfeeds&utm_campaign=Feed%3A+fastcompany%2Fheadlines+%28Fast+Company%29" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">uploading</a></span><span> close-up pics to Google's AI dermatologist.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Erase your </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-05-18/google-adds-feature-to-zap-recent-search-history-in-privacy-push?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">last 15 minutes</a></span><span> of Google queries, so no one searches "fall" on their browser and gets prompted, "best fall out boy song.”</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">In Google Photos...</strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>You'll be able to password-protect sensitive photos, like your 8,000 middle school selfies, in a new </span><span><a href="https://www.theverge.com/2021/5/18/22442416/google-photos-locked-folder-private-hidden-pictures?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Locked Folder</a></span><span>.</span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Soon you can </span><span><a href="https://www.theverge.com/2021/5/18/22442466/google-photos-cinematic-moments-animated-android-ios-machine-learning?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">combine</a></span><span> several still images into an animated, "cinematic moment." </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">There's more: </strong>Google is <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/google-aims-for-commercial-grade-quantum-computer-by-2029-11621359156?mod=hp_lista_pos3" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">dropping a few billi</a> to try and build the first-ever commercial-grade quantum computer by 2029. It could solve complex problems—like creating a low-CO2 fertilizer alternative—millions of times faster than a conventional computer.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Parent Alphabet may have <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/01/22/google-parent-alphabet-shuts-loon?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">scaled back</a> some moonshot projects, but it continues to use Google's cash-cow advertising unit to invest in futuristic services that range from practical to pie-in-the-sky.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>Jack adapted his organization to the ever-changing demands of the real world. </em>(Yep, even nursery rhymes mean business here at the Brew.)</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We don’t need to get into how much disruption the world has seen lately—you know it, we know it. Jack definitely knows it.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">What we <em>do</em> want to get into is how we learned about the different ways businesses have remained <strong style="color:#000">agile and adaptable after a year of unprecedented change</strong> by listening to <a href="http://www.quickbase.com/podcast?utm_source=morning-brew&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=2021-5-19" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Quickbase’s new podcast, <em>Age of Agility</em></a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s the pod where business and industry leaders impart operational wisdom and everything they’ve implemented to build the <strong style="color:#000">adaptive systems, processes, and functions necessary to survive and thrive</strong>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Topics range from tips on employee engagement and performance to the shipping logistics behind your lost package last Christmas.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Tune in to <em>Age of Agility</em> anywhere you find your favorite podcasts—or heck, <a href="http://www.quickbase.com/podcast?utm_source=morning-brew&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=2021-5-19" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">right over here</a>.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENTERTAINMENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/18/amazon-reportedly-negotiating-9b-acquisition-mgm-studios?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Prime Time for MGM
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>

<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/18/amazon-reportedly-negotiating-9b-acquisition-mgm-studios" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="An illustration of the gold MGM crest and name in front of a black background. Instead of a roaring lion in the middle, Jeff Bezos's head is pictured scrunched up and laughing. " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81MTI2L21nbV9iZXpvcy5wbmciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Toby Howell</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Metro Goldwyn Mayer...Bezos? Earlier this week, The Information <a href="https://www.theinformation.com/articles/amazon-pondering-deal-to-buy-mgm?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reported</a> that Amazon is negotiating an acquisition of MGM Studios that would sandwich Prime staples like <em>Mrs. Maisel</em> and <em>Jack Ryan</em> between acclaimed MGM franchises including <em>James Bond</em>, <em>Rocky</em>, <em>RoboCop</em>, and <em>Survivor</em>. Variety later <a href="https://variety.com/2021/digital/news/amazon-mgm-acquisition-talks-9-billion-1234975168/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reported</a> the terms are worth $9 billion.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Entertainment is one of Amazon's fastest-growing business units, and last year 175 million of Prime's 200 million members used its streaming service. Amazon accordingly upped spending on TV, movies, and music 40% last year, including a jaw-dropping $465 million for the first season of a new <em>Lord of the Rings</em> series. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> News of a potential MGM acquisition comes against the backdrop of an increasingly competitive streaming landscape. AT&T's WarnerMedia just <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/17/atts-warnermedia-discovery-confirm-merger-reports?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">confirmed</a> that it’s merging with Discovery into a $120+ billion entertainment giant next year.</p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
BLACK WALL STREET
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Digging Into the Data
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You've already read a lot of words (2,104 to be exact) from <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/black-wall-street-100-years-later?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Black Wall Street, 100 Years Later</a> series. May we interest you in some charts?</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We sifted through what felt like terabytes of data to highlight the most compelling narratives in Black finance today, from a dramatic decrease in Black-owned banks to workforce diversity statistics at the highest levels of the industry. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/18/8-charts-explore-racial-disparities-banking-industry?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Check out the charts here</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And don't forget, we've got a TikTok series exploring the OG Black Wall Street, Tulsa's Greenwood District. <a href="https://vm.tiktok.com/ZMeGnyRSD/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Part 3 is up today</a>.</p>

Here are some <a href="https://www.washingtonian.com/2021/05/03/the-author-of-a-popular-cicada-cookbook-on-how-to-cook-eat-cicadas/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">bug eating tips and recipes</a> and here's an <a href="http://www.tullabs.com/cicadaworld/cicadarecipes.pdf?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">entire digital cicada cookbook</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Shrek turns 20:</strong> Onions have layers. Ogres have layers. And the classic film <em>Shrek</em> has new layers we keep discovering...usually at 2am while downing pizza. <a href="https://www.polygon.com/movies/22434538/shrek?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Polygon</a> and <a href="https://www.theringer.com/movies/2021/5/18/22441492/shrek-internet-obsession-meme-fodder-movie-anniversary?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">The Ringer</a> gave it the nostalgic deep dive it deserves.</p>
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><sup style="display: inline-block; line-height: 16px;">*This is sponsored advertising content</sup></p>

style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nENVIRONMENT\n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nHow to Become the Net-Zero Hero\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/18/iea-sets-400-step-plan-reach-2050-climate-goals\" style=\"text-decoration:none;border:none;\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"An illustration of a generic-looking brick factory; trees are growing out of the top of its three smokestacks\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zODU4L3N1c3RhaW5hYmlsaXR5LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn a halftime speech for the ages, the International Energy Agency \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/iea-analysis-charts-narrow-pathway-to-paris-climate-goal-a337723f-cc56-4186-937c-963be7791c26.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereleased\u003c/a\u003e a major report yesterday urging countries to go out there and score their 2050 climate goals. The path is \"narrow and extremely challenging\" but can be done...if they start now. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat are those goals? \u003c/strong\u003eTo prevent the worst effects of climate change, the 2015 Paris Agreement set a 2050 deadline to reach net-zero emissions and cap the rise in global temperatures above preindustrial levels at 1.5°C. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSo the IEA went full Leslie Knope and \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/2021/05/18/997834721/no-new-oil-and-coal-projects-now-to-be-carbon-neutral-by-2050-report-says?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereleased\u003c/a\u003e 400+ milestones for governments, including...\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBlocking new investments in oil and gas fields starting next year\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eEnding the sale of internal combustion engine-powered cars by 2035\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eQuadrupling the amount of new solar and wind capacity that is added annually by 2040\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe messenger matters.\u003c/strong\u003e The IEA was set up in the 1970s to help keep oil supplies stable and affordable. It's expanded that focus to other energy sources and global policy, but has always been seen as cozy with the fossil fuel industry.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eSo what changed?\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eShort answer: The status quo isn't cutting it. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhile more countries have made net-zero pledges, emissions are still rising. And, based on existing national targets, the IEA estimates that by 2050 there will still be 22 billion tons of CO2 emissions.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn the US, 59% of electricity was generated using natural gas or coal last year, according to the US Energy Information Administration.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe gameplan\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSome countries have taken big steps—Denmark pledged an end to new fossil fuel exploration, the UK is phasing out new sales of gas-powered vehicles. But it's not enough, the IEA said. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe agency says humans have the technology to make most of the CO2 cuts needed by 2030, but some of the technologies needed after that are still in R\u0026D. Therefore, the report's authors called for more innovation in technologies including hydrogen production, battery tech, and carbon capture, and more investment to decarbonize industries including aviation, transportation, and construction. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003egovernments have six months to simmer on these recs before the UN Climate Change Conference in Glasgow, Scotland, this November.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSheeeeeeesh Gen Z readers (did we use that right?), because Fidelity \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/business-369bf5f29e39ee441829c1de4cfeedd1?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ejust launched\u003c/a\u003e trading accounts for 13–17-year-olds. That means teens can open an account to make deposits, use a debit card, or trade stocks, mutual funds, and most ETFs. To sign up, they just need a parent with a Fidelity account, who will be able to keep tabs on their kids' transactions but—unlike other products on the market today—can't block them.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIf it feels like your investing friends \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/world/us/fidelity-launches-brokerage-account-aimed-13-17-year-olds-2021-05-18/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ekeep getting younger\u003c/a\u003e, they are: Investors opened 4.1 million new brokerage accounts on Fidelity last quarter, and 1.6 million were run by people 35 and younger, a 223% annual increase.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWith young traders entering the market in droves during the pandemic, Fidelity wants to become middle- and high schoolers' first and only active investing option.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ewhen teens with Fidelity Youth Accounts turn 18, their account switches into Fidelity's standard brokerage offering for grown-ups. So this banking product's not just Gen Z's first Finance 101 class, but a longer-term customer acquisition strategy.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\"
